meanings.definition: Lure or entice someone or something into a trap.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox baits the rabbit with a shiny object.
meanings.sent2: She baits her little brother into playing hide-and-seek with her.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat baits the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The villain baits the hero into a dangerous situation.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of freshly baked cookies baits everyone into the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Food used to attract fish or other animals for catching or hunting.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman prepared different baits to catch a variety of fish.
meanings.sent2: The birdwatcher set up bird feeders with various baits to attract different species.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon managed to steal the bait from the trap without getting caught.
meanings.sent4: The hunter carefully selected the perfect bait to lure the elusive prey.
meanings.sent5: The colorful lures and baits in the tackle box sparkled in the sunlight.
